laboratory_examinations.findings: Blood pressure initially recorded as 150/80 mmHg before trauma, then as low as 55 mmHg post-surgery.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure recorded at 105/65 mmHg before induction and decreased to 90 mmHg during anesthesia.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Regular sinus rhythm with occasional PVCs; monitored during anesthesia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant tachycardia; however, frequent PVCs occurred after surgery, lasting several days.
Mild hypomagnesemia observed and treated with intravenous magnesium sulfate.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete Blood Count and Liver Function Tests
laboratory_examinations.findings: Liver enzymes elevated: AST to 221 IU/L, ALT to 220 IU/L, ALP to 214 IU/L, GGT to 268 IU/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Liver enzyme levels elevated over time, reaching peaks after administration of bupivacaine.
Postoperative temperature in one case showed a gradual increase, reaching baseline in 50 minutes.
